title: Heart-pounding moment angry lion is only feet from tourists' safari car
text:
A group of tourists were left fearing for their lives after being chased by a lion as their car zooms away during a safari.

The footage was taken in Atal Bihari Vajpayee Zoological Park in Karnataka, India, where the tour group spotted the big cat.

As the vehicle drives down the dusty path the animal chases after them as someone films from the back seat.

The beast is just a few metres away (pictured) before the car drives faster and manages to leave the lion behind

As the vehicle drives down the dusty path in Atal Bihari Vajpayee Zoological Park in Karnataka, India, the animal chases after them as someone films from the back seat

The beast is just a few metres away before the car drives faster and manages to leave the lion behind.

The car then stops further down the path and the lion keeps on approaching. The vehicle eventually leaves it behind.

Local reports claim the lion tried to pounce on the car but the driver managed to escape.

Luckily nobody was injured in the incident and it is not known what caused the aggression from the lion.

It isn't the first time a group of safari tourists have been chased on camera before.

An angry rhino chased a jeep of safari-goers for 500 yards down a dirt track on a game reserve in South Africa in August this year.
